column4: Is there any way to install a kernel in the live cd or kboot and get the original kernel from the live cd onto my ubuntu without having to reinstall ubuntu altogether?
Can't you select recovery mode from GRUB?
From grub menu - either sleect recovery mode or select an older kernel (if you havent dleeted them)
How do I get to the GRUB menu?  What can I do in recovery mode?
Just boot up you should se it... If not -> http://odzangba.wordpress.com/2007/03/10/how-to-restore-grub-using-the-ubuntu-live-cd/
there aren't any good N64 emulators for Linux?
Dunno... but  wouldn't expect them to run appreciably faster..
there's mupen not sure how good
do you know what I could do to my PC hardware wise to speed up the emulation? add more ram?
No, that is mostly a matter of graphical and CPU horsepower unfortunately...
so I would probably need a new graphics card or a new processor altogether?
I don't know what your processor is, but I have a p4 2.4 ghz and 1GB and good graphics and it's still not quite perfect :)
